summary: This document is an email chain regarding the procurement of NICE drives (Seagate hard drives) for the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It involves a SigNet Technologies program manager and an Electronics Technician at the correctional center arranging shipment of drives to the facility.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: Program Manager at SigNet Technologies handling contracts, recipient of email regarding shipment of NICE drives to Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Electronics Technician
persons.context: Unnamed Electronics Technician at Metropolitan Correctional Center requesting three Seagate hard drives (one for empty slot, two for spares) to be shipped to the facility.

connections.description: Business communication regarding procurement and shipment of electronic equipment (NICE drives) from SigNet Technologies to the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Request for NICE Drives Shipment
events.description: Email correspondence arranging shipment of three Seagate hard drives (NICE drives) to the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
SigNet Technologies, 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville MD 20705
keyFacts: The Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York requested three Seagate hard drives (model 5T3320620AV) from SigNet Technologies in December 2017.
The shipment was directed to the Metropolitan Correctional Center at 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007.
The document shows procurement activity for electronic equipment at the correctional facility where Jeffrey Epstein was later held.
